fe1186c9-70e9-44a8-b53d-1a8a5cfd76cf: "...will fall!" {n}The cold eyes of the huntress pin the other mongrels to the ground like iron nails.{/n}
4b3000b1-54c0-4bf9-a1b6-9b04fdfee9be: "A beast already lives within my soul."
2358c3fc-3857-4037-a79e-7896768a83be: "A bit of respect for my {mf|master|mistress}, Sull! We didn't come for you. We came for our warriors."
fcf58d3b-bb92-46c6-8395-88cac2d2d156: "A demon who wants to turn all my tribesfolk into his slaves. You met him once before, {mf|master|mistress}, in the Shield Maze. He didn't fight you back then, but now we have to track him down and kill him. His poison is the magic potion that awakens our rage and strength, and if we get it... Oh, we'll be unstoppable."
de6332d6-e7ed-43cf-b855-0e2d9d58e746: "A drunken brawl that turned into a stabbing spree. By the time I left the tavern, two people had already succumbed to their injuries. I can only pray to Iomedae that the number of dead won't rise while I am away."
11fe5486-8070-4d5a-a869-8d15d6d99cc4: "A friendly brawl is the best way to relieve tension." {n}Wenduag's shoulders sag, and her eyes look tired.{/n} "Our last few exploits are weighing on me... Talk to me, would you? I don't want to carry it all inside anymore." {n}Her voice cracks painfully.{/n}
2f1964d8-9db4-439c-8dbb-4600b620e5ce: "A girl like me can always find a willing partner any time she wants to have sex. And I rarely don't want it. In the caves, I usually chose Lann. Sometimes there were strong hunters from other tribes who I found attractive. And, of course, Hosilla. Could she resist dragging me into her bed? Of course she couldn't."
d4c99122-da98-4fab-8b0f-3ae95c4055a3: "A pack of my wild, bloodthirsty kin, as well as many others who have yet to receive their new power. Together we will turn the scattered tribes into an invincible army that destroys everything in its path."
601cb74c-f7cb-4dfa-ac26-9db6d53c638b: "A swarm of vescavors is power incarnate, destroying everything in its path! But what is the point of such power if you're too mindless to enjoy it?"
45c75e69-e94c-40c8-a634-a6081d4c6f36: "Accept it? Not a chance! Neathers do not weakly accept, they fight to the end! And that tradition certainly isn't going to end under Chief Wenduag!" {n}Baring her teeth fiercely, she looks at you with defiance.{/n}
a3d1b67b-7a3a-4df2-aef2-f5c32606e6c6: "Admit it, you didn't want to kill Lann. I could tell."
788688eb-0704-4e82-8b49-cebece1db03d: "After I left Neathholm, I started hunting demons. I know it sounds stupid, but I thought I was doing something important... Although, hand on heart, I was really just looking for an enemy to chop my head off. But then I heard the news that Savamelekh had abducted the people of my tribe from Drezen, so I set out looking for him. Luckily, it's not too difficult for a skilled hunter to track down an army of angry mongrels, even if they're in the Worldwound."
ad6aa31f-e30b-41ad-aa01-d2ac4e80b04a: "After all, we are fighters. We are tough and strong, and we do what it takes to survive. We'll try to make a better life for ourselves, and if we fail, then at least we'll die fighting for our future."
9d6a9fb2-2c82-41af-b6b0-915c353dbeea: "After everything we've been through together... you were ready to switch sides? You were willing to serve Savamelekh?"
87c9f2a7-843e-4130-a53a-4cc5f5d2455a: "Ah, I don't have time for this!"
ce324eaa-b929-4102-b8a1-9906687edc89: "Ah, that's nothing. I had a fight with a few crusaders. Five of them, to be precise. But I think I got the one on my chin before that. Now that was a good honest fight, one on one."
f47d3b4c-4df5-4c4c-b51f-5f4eafa9b501: "Ahhh, more victims... Anyone else want to join these two losers?" {n}The huntress nods casually at the bodies at her feet. Her speech is slightly slurred, but the alcohol has not deprived her of her deadly grace.{/n} "Get lost, maggots. My {mf|master|mistress} will see that no harm comes my way, understand? Move along while you can still move at all."
405edea1-4fba-45b7-9c43-7fba31380351: "All of you are mine. You and those behind you and those standing here right now." {n}Savamelekh makes a gesture and mongrels assume threatening stances.{/n} "Choose, child — you either become one of my servants or die at their claws." {n}Turning casually to his warriors, Savamelekh says,{/n} "Kill."
1aac25ae-3268-4d5e-934f-9c2ad3e8f793: "All right, I will allow you to be my servant. But we will hold off on attacking the crusader camp for now — the fate of Drezen will be sealed soon enough. Instead, stay where you are now — next to the Commander. Sooner or later, {mf|he|she} will return to Golarion and try to take away my children. I will be waiting for {mf|him|her}, and you will stab {mf|him|her} in the back. You can do that, can't you?"
b3d92cfc-76d2-42d2-a675-8a46752b7310: "All right, move along. And remember, if you get captured again, I'm not going to lift a finger to free you. If anyone's stupid enough to get caught a second time, they're clearly a burden to the tribe and deserve to die."
b70d1a06-7f1b-4a25-a8e9-1f593be3b0f0: "All right, you can stay. You might still be useful to me."
311455b1-afa2-4e59-bce2-8928a8a554b4: "All right. There's no point in trying to guess the future — it will always find a way to surprise us, usually by sinking its teeth into our most vulnerable spot at the worst possible moment."
6271b7ca-cf15-4a64-96f7-f06780682b77: "All right? She has never been better. I am calling to my blood and it is answering. It is seething in her veins, whispering, 'Kill.' It promises the sweet taste of raw meat, the hot splash of blood on your face, horrifying screams, and quivering flesh in your claws. Could you resist that?"
88a9222f-c247-4673-aeaf-9a54b299df44: "Almosht nothing. While we walked from Neathholm to Drezhen, she wash a big help. Tended to woundsh, calmed those who were frightened under the sky... She likesh it on the shurface. Alwaysh trading, she ish — herbsh for toolsh, potions for suppliesh... She likesh to trade very much."
0be761c8-630a-4ff7-ba71-f7595c931f02: "Alushinyrra... now here's a city to my taste. There is life here, there is struggle! I could be chief here!"
9957a74c-b2da-40f1-bab1-27304e26d396: "Am I imagining things, or do you find me attractive?"
9ee3ea34-b0dd-4514-9105-827d62994dd9: "Am I really that important to you?"
0e2c1e76-cb5a-4f59-8c23-8d2dd1fc1a3e: "And I you." {n}The alacrity with which these words fly from Wenduag's lips causes her to flinch and look up at you in terror. Fixing a devil-may-care smile on her face, the huntress forces out a hearty chuckle.{/n} "I know I'm certainly going to survive this fight. How about you try your best to survive as well, hmm? Because I swear, if you die, I won't be weeping over your grave."
c6ff826d-f077-4ab7-b580-24c93954b530: "And also because being close to you is a good way to live. I love life, I'm young and strong. It makes sense to eat, drink, screw, and kill enemies while you are young, not when you are thirty thousand gongs old and shriveled up like Sull. As long as I'm your servant, I can have fun as I like and order around anyone I want. Who will dare defy me? No one!" {n}Her eyes drift half-closed in smug satisfaction.{/n}
8266ce33-590d-4c64-8f9b-878c5c7c52ab: "And he started yelling that I 'stole' from him, and a crowd gathered, and everyone was giving me dirty looks, like they were all so superior. As if I was some savage who crawled out of her hole just to bother these squeaky-clean scumbags! What do they know? In Neathholm, every craftsman sees it as an honor if a hunter chooses his weapon! And these uplanders... Ugh!" {n}Wenduag's eyes are ablaze and she lets out a hiss, baring her teeth, but bewilderment still seeps into her voice.{/n}
f1e2d2be-9f76-4558-9129-7cb53e9b466a: "And kill {mf|him|her} you shall, my special child. And as a reward for doing so, I will grant you the poison from my stinger. It will make you perfect, and my children will be graced with a true queen."
5836e3ad-db52-4158-8473-5a09516b85cb: "And now every time that pointy-tailed freak raises his brow, my brain starts melting! So is that my fate now — to be their damned slave? I'm livestock now, don't you see? They created me and raised me like cattle! And from now on, for you, I'll be nothing but a rabid beast you managed to put a leash on."
40f4ea7e-2aa1-4426-8776-29087813371c: "And until we 'persuade' them, you aren't sending the tribe anywhere? Have I got that right, Sull? You're a slippery one. Like a stone at the bottom of an underground stream. Come on, give me the name. Who still has doubts — it's Lann, right? Is he setting the tribes against us?"
ac510b88-f9c7-4696-ab90-9f85933341b8: "And we no longer have a purpose. We have no future. We are orphans now, and this world is cruel to orphans — both on the surface, and in the caves. We are no longer cursed with short lifespans, and the Shield Maze is no longer our prison. We are not bound to live behind its walls, but... are we really free? In the eyes of the uplanders, we'll never be anything but a bunch of unwanted strangers, the children of shame."
df0fc957-3103-492f-9276-d21c4715d65c: "And you are my prey." {n}Wenduag's lips twist into a cruel grin as the demon nervously flaps his wings. His eyes dart around the surrounding ruins, searching for an escape.{/n} "I can see it. I can feel your fear. There is nowhere for you to hide. It is time for you to accept your demise. And I will deal the final blow. You stole my father from me. You took what I loved most. So now I will take what you value most — your life." {n}The huntress raises her weapon, and her smile is as cold as ice. It is the smile of mountain cliffs as they watch overconfident climbers tumble to their deaths. It is the smile of the raging ocean when a drunken sailor drowns in its depths. It is a smile that promises death.{/n}
1281055c-041a-4b41-8523-535155cfb7f9: "And you weren't afraid to go after that monster to save your friend?"
32454f4e-b1bb-4d06-939b-9d16eaf8c11a: "Are you ashamed that we killed Lann in a dishonorable way?"
2e6a62e2-ac56-4c40-a28b-39e2bd7eeb0d: "Are you going to start avoiding me now?"
80c10cd6-b6f4-4ee9-b341-cd889e0b7e64: "Are you really willing to change for me? Truly... I could ask for nothing more. Thank you, my love."
99683d06-e440-454f-9469-07555900760f: "Are you sure you are ready to enter?"
22f396fe-ef94-435d-9774-aaa3c43eb7c4: "Are you talking about courting? Yes, we have that tradition too. If a man and a woman want to make a family and belong to each other. But if we're talking about just one night... or maybe several nights, when they give their bodies to each other for the sake of pleasure and good company — why bother with courting in that case? Life's too short as it is, especially for those who spend it fighting — so it's better to grab everything you can get, while you can get it."
5f929982-fa04-4e83-aebf-3eca11de5d43: "Are you trying to say that you need someone to warm you up with a kiss?"
b563b025-c7f9-4294-8653-24ea36414661: "Are you... serious?" {n}Wenduag stares at you blankly.{/n} "I thought you were just... It doesn't matter. Go on, then, lecture me."
159e0b2c-7125-4b84-9137-532e7a45a03d: "Aren't you ashamed of betraying your kin?"
ede40ddf-e223-4e2a-8a7b-704b7e2236a0: "Aren't you embarrassed to be flirting with me like this?"
3f089b37-33a8-42ab-a83c-cf89b0e3cef3: "As you command, {mf|master|mistress}. See how obedient you've made me?"
933dc9d4-2b5c-411e-94cf-2efbe104e408: "As you wish. But don't forget about what I asked. I'd like to come back here and talk to you about something. Just the two of us." {n}A playful glimmer dances in Wenduag's eyes.{/n}
a4bb6d0d-b298-44d3-bccd-f3d537b6fe41: "As you wish. I will never abandon my tribe again, but I will leave you alone. Farewell, and thanks again for saving us."
f9d43eeb-3068-4f70-b84d-d3e06b5c24d9: "Back in Neathholm, I used to fight all the time. But there were only few willing to go up against me — they all learned very quickly that I show no mercy."
b9f7c25f-ab31-43bb-8cbc-211f61932bba: "Battles used to excite you, not scare you."
e14eb636-3f93-4259-92d2-1c5f49cf9c63: "Because I could. I've been scheming since day one. All this time, I've been plotting to overthrow you. I trained my fighters to obey me and me alone. I eliminated anyone who posed a threat to my plans. In Alushinyrra, I secretly contacted Savamelekh and made a deal. This whole time, you had no idea that I was working behind your back. Your blind trust made you weak, and it was only natural that I should try and exploit that weakness."
0dd9066c-c7b1-4af4-a1af-cfe1b8b55775: "Because I could. I've been scheming since day one. This whole time, I've been planning to overthrow you. You did notice a few of my 'preparations'... But I managed to get away with most of them."
0387ffb6-ce85-4fd5-a7ca-849a6dca6b07: "Because I know that, when it comes down to it, people only care about themselves. I'm prepared for any of my companions to betray me."
7750af24-c60b-4175-8195-79de51b30450: "Because I'm a neather. I must be with my tribe. Someone has to tend to the wounds of the hun... I mean, of the soldiers. Someone has to make potions for the sick. Someone has to feed them. My fellow tribesmen don't know how to live like uplanders, but I know a little. I can buy... a chicken, for example. Can the others? Of course not. They have no idea what money is, they mix up the coins, they are scared of live chickens."
cac68a53-75ce-44e3-bcb2-2240bcb83eb4: "Because I'm not like you. We can keep on pretending as long as we want, but... I'm not an ordinary mortal. I was created by demons. You can turn a blind eye to the truth, but you'll never fully understand me until you become like me... at least a little. A cruel, hungry beast howls within my soul. If you do not hear its call, we can never truly be together."
75289abc-6a1d-4e69-9c1b-dbe6b6165e23: "Because Sull would just ignore any other uplander who came to him demanding that he gather the tribes and attack the demons. I think he has always hoped that the fated day when neathers would return to the surface would come after his death. He is worried that he will lead the tribes to their deaths. That's why Sull is going to cling to the rock he's hiding under with all this strength. We have to drag him out from under it."
e8150330-970d-450d-8222-ba59644bfe98: "Because you know that if you betray me, I will make you pay for it in blood."
700072ee-db89-4ee4-9b43-e9b476969db7: "Because you're not like any other uplander. You understand and I can speak frankly with you. Besides, you value me higher than those losers."
5f8c4d3e-f913-4f75-a804-3897df76fa93: "Before Nocticula became a demon lord, she killed one of them using cunning, not strength. That is how she removed Baphomet from her path. She acted as is her custom."
84eefc43-95e0-4377-a2b1-0e7c58ac8ee0: "Behaving like that in front of everyone is unwise. Turning my soldiers against you... That could be dangerous."
c9148ec2-ff08-44e4-b8de-6c117f193dc0: "Besides, as the Commander once said, '{mf|He|She} is a legend of the crusades. Why would I want any competition?'"
1f7711d2-0e4d-4b76-a466-1a9e08486b7d: "Better, but I worry about my fellow tribeshmen. I'm afraid the demonsh have sunk their clawsh in too deep, and there'sh no hope for shalvation anymore..."
a213fcde-20fd-49b8-ab71-f3559ec4f542: "Blind fools! You thought you could push me around? You thought I'd be your servant?"
bdabd286-6acf-4a6b-90f8-1750d27fa518: "But I didn't. Though I must admit, it was a close call. But I believed you were powerful enough to survive, and I was right. You passed the trial, and now we... share a bond. I wanted to open up to you before, but until you shared the poison that shaped me into who I am, you would never have been able to fully understand me. This venom in my veins would have always been a barrier between us. But now, it brings us closer together."
0975a3b3-6161-45af-a567-e133546826cb: "But I don't know how to trust! I've always been alone, all by myself! The only person I trusted was my father, but he... he..." {n}Angry tears roll down Wenduag's cheeks.{/n} "He didn't even recognize me!" {n}With a sob, Wenduag burrows her head into your chest — no longer the tough huntress, but a lonely little girl who's lost in the dark, dank caves.{/n} "And now I'm all wet... What a pathetic sight. So what should I do now? Tell me."
0cf5d762-7779-4e74-a789-acdc29beaeca: "But I feel foolish, out of place... Everyone seems to be feeling the weight of this moment, eagerly preparing to deal the final rebuff to the demon invasion and save Golarion. But for me, it's just one more battle I'm going to fight because you chose me to be by your side. It's incredible — I'm in this wretched place risking my neck because some uplander wants me to... Wenduag, you're an idiot."
311a8412-4f57-43f0-88a4-0dc1e315177a: "But I guess you do have a point. I... I've been a real bitch, but you never stopped treating me with respect and understanding... even though I didn't deserve it. You covered for me when I made mistakes, you supported me when I felt helpless and confused... Damn, you're the first person I ever decided to be loyal to until the end!"
65765636-3ef1-4a9e-b927-fa73891ae49f: "But I handled it because I was the strongest of them all! Not a single day have I regretted the power I gained, and that's why I am not ashamed of sharing that power with my tribe."
11c8ae98-3684-410a-8544-267fd4893433: "But if she tries to come between us, I'll cut her pretty face so no one will ever look twice at her again. Succubus whore!"
14a5cec5-d8f3-4ca6-843c-bda33081bf68: "But what you need is freedom and hunting. You'll be sad sitting on a throne all day."
ec78248d-f55c-427a-b6b8-41a9ea525186: "But you are a savage. What other response can you expect when you behave like that?"
f9c4ff0a-a16b-4f1a-9f69-eabfc8722cc7: "But you are already strong. You don't need other people's secrets, you are enough on your own."
6d715515-3eff-4014-a5ce-4d88e531f32a: "But you knew all this about me already when you invited me into your party. You knew that I would always covet your power, that I would desire it for my own. You knew that my companionship came with conditions... but you accepted my help, despite my ambitions. There are some who seek unconditional loyalty from those around them. They surround themselves with mediocre servants, companions who are too afraid to dream of anything greater than a life of slavery and servitude. But you are different."
767b7fae-dfac-4de6-8e21-097eb9af4898: "But you, Commander. You are different. Your arrival into this world, a world destined to bow down before you, is a true cause for celebration!"
5edd7192-6a39-445e-a77f-78484be68861: "But {mf|master|mistress}, none of them would dare show you any disrespect... For they know how sincerely I admire you and how keen I am to obey your every order."
acf44e47-9b12-4c8a-bdbe-93a2bf00455e: "By the time we get out of here, this place will be nothing but rubble!"
c852f3a3-ca31-4ff0-bc95-110d4f9f4728: "Calm down. It was just a joke."
9af891e8-8059-42b6-9c98-1b9588076855: "Can you hear me? Answer me, curse you!" {n}Wenduag's voice shakes you from your feverish, pain-filled dreams. She sounds frantic, as if she's been calling you for some time with no response.{/n}
1d29c790-7fb9-41a2-be34-2a026e0b3cd0: "Can't we sholve this without shpilling blood? The timesh we live in."
79dce2cd-a734-4b4b-9391-8a291a951507: "Chaos, blood... they are horrible, but we must wade through it all to win and see a better world."
0e9b3299-aeb4-49b3-91bc-9312148a9b73: "Children cannot be held responsible for the sins of their fathers."
73222a94-ea72-49b1-a62c-2b99a2c36ff4: "Comfort a fighter who's not afraid of blades or demon claws? Don't be ridiculous."
0f1dd99c-a167-4d82-804c-ba95a0d8656e: "Commander! We've got trouble — your companion, Wenduag, she's gone berserk. She wreaked havoc in the tavern, there are casualties. You must intervene — or allow me to handle it myself."
b886fcdb-1373-4ed8-8a3f-a6397c4a2a1b: "Commander, thank you for heeding my requesht. I need to share my worriesh with you." {n}Sull uneasily glances back at Wenduag, who is intently checking her equipment, then lowers his lisping voice almost to a whisper.{/n}
e3147065-5fa1-4934-a325-9760fc9aa888: "Conquer? Why would he need to conquer us if we're his creations?" {n}Wenduag's voice breaks, and you hear the confusion and pain in it.{/n}
b021245b-004e-4645-bbc4-f3bb9bc1640a: "Consider it done!" {n}Irabeth frowns, but salutes you and leaves.{/n}
b13001d3-f625-4668-9a93-219f45399e32: "Crusaders treat mongrels with caution because of mongrels like her. When you behave like a savage, you will be viewed like a savage, one who deserves no place among civilized mortals."
f0bca3df-1928-49b8-be8f-8d7ebc16a152: "Deadly. All of Savamelekh's servants ate meat laced with his poison, but only a few of his strongest followers were allowed to experience the kiss of his sting. It was a great honor — though only a handful survived." {n}The huntress watches you closely to see your reaction.{/n}
d09b32ec-54df-4ca6-a857-cef86d77c867: "Decent? You're mediocre at best. But never mind. I'll train you up, Lann. Can't have you embarrassing us all when our army marches against the demons."
4856a2e2-c6a6-4b13-b8e4-b1cd1e378514: "Decide the best course of action for yourself."
d78ed859-410e-4fdb-8432-43cad09a043c: "Demons? That's all in the past, I assure you! I serve only you and I live to destroy your enemies! You are my only law! Do you want to punish me? I'll accept any punishment from you!"
2bf4e5f1-3624-408d-9873-74a926e07482: "Devious, but dangerous and powerful. Her strikes are so decisive, so inevitable... the thought alone is quite mesmerizing."
d350784a-398c-48c4-b416-f1cde7c6c3f4: "Did I make you angry? You weren't expecting me to make things easy for you, were you? If you want to own me, you must subdue me first."
722860a1-c544-4841-ad37-54b6727263d8: "Did he destroy my people? Or did he give them their best chance of survival? You will raise us up above all other mortals, won't you, Savamelekh?"
ec39ff59-05a0-4272-a3f3-5408499fc19c: "Did you and Lann have some kind of arrangement?"
c54cf107-9c1c-4aaf-bb65-a3b3f536ba3c: "Did you get it out of your system? Good, now get out of my sight before I change my mind and give you a real injury."
63a1d95f-bc14-4b7f-a7ee-487781a705fd: "Did you look up to your father?"
24c13a71-0d49-4080-bdda-34012a4ff91c: "Did you really call me your 'dear one'? That's so sweet."
a6cc6ce8-41c0-41ee-b427-f5a09c2f2939: "Do uplandersh care about ush? And who would I send? Those few huntersh we had in the tribe are gone... They said they heard an ominoush whishper in their headsh. They said it called them to the cavesh, and they could not resisht. And they went, all of them, one after another. And they alsho said that shoon 'he' will come — and all of ush will be together again. And all of ush will be his."{n} Sull shakes his head hopelessly.{/n} "I don't know who they are talking about."
8c12ef9a-0ee4-41d1-857d-35354ffad5ef: "Do you believe what Savamelekh said about your ancestors?"
addcad2e-f127-4a20-8599-1a53c5f5cbaa: "Do you have any idea who could be involved in this?"
2641606b-3783-4258-bf0a-1ce08a5a6073: "Do you know what would make this perfect? A nice, satisfying kill. A kill, a drink — and then back to bed."
e6f6e8f5-4800-4952-87ca-a0e892bab521: "Do you really care what they think of you?"
9c3c4a96-dc35-4205-98db-bca6519dfdc8: "Do you want me to give you a warmer blanket?"
ae75bc3b-cb63-4009-b6e2-edcdd9a68571: "Does that little bitch Arueshalae think I don't see her looking at the Commander? Ha, they can enjoy themselves as much as they want, they have my permission."
2c886ddd-7132-4723-9fcc-c291a3074d61: "Does the sight of a dead demon turn you on?"
c8d9e286-26fc-493e-82fa-5077e936d8bd: "Don't forget — you promised not to leave me. Try not to break that promise, or else I'll be furious with you..."
463547f0-8b19-4964-9c13-35bc69ed4f70: "Don't laugh. I realize how it looks — a nasty, cynical bitch transformed by the power of love. No, I know I don't deserve such a gift, but... I can try to earn it." {n}Wenduag hesitates, then says slowly,{/n} "Do you want me to change? Would you like me to act more like an uplander, and believe all that stuff about kindness, honor, and dedication? I can't promise that I'll succeed, but I can try. For you."
6f9459e9-284a-40f4-8e2a-3f78156b98e0: "Don't pass out! Talk to me! What are you feeling? Stay with me, whatever you do!"
2d580c03-8cfb-4dc7-8db6-10a55bee29e9: "Don't push it. And get on your knees when you speak to me."
feed043d-cbc6-47b2-8b8f-1dec5f740f57: "Don't think you've 'tamed' me now. You'll have to try much harder to do that."
227ab397-829e-4644-b2a7-2ff990498bd5: "Don't worry, everything will be all right."
a10151b3-f173-4e2a-a020-1513485637be: "Don't worry. You're going to be all right, you're strong."
59c9c979-fdf5-4061-99a5-5167fa2cf6f6: "Don't you dare! If you want servants, find your own! Leave mine to me!" {n}Savamelekh's voice all but rises to a screech.{/n}
5031ccf9-9b67-4034-8a55-5a140ba7dcbd: "Don't you dare! You hear me? Don't you dare leave me here alone! Stay awake, keep talking! You understand me, you damned uplander? Just hold on!" {n}Wenduag shakes you frantically. Her claws pierce your skin as she grasps your shoulders, but you no longer feel any pain.{/n}
4c25f3dd-573b-47fe-a6fc-2fb5bcaab327: "Don't you ever say anything like that to the Commander, you old fool! Do I have to hit you again?" {n}Waiting for the old man to shake his head, Wenduag nods with content.{/n} "What, are you crying? Stop it. Sobbing old men are disgusting!"
01d48b61-2949-492c-9b85-c436d7b20821: "Don't you see? We are special. There is no one else like us in the entire world. We're the only ones left — all the others are dead. Look into my eyes. What do you see?" {n}Wenduag brings her face close to yours, and you see yourself reflected in her huge, cat-like eyes.{/n} "When I look into your eyes, I see myself."
674c478c-d753-4d01-aa75-3b8345a34fff: "Don't you think we're being lured into a trap?"
3ca2f02a-a999-4eca-8aaf-c8ca4e4c6bc4: "Down in the caves, we don't place any special meaning on the number of gongs that have passed since birth. We had other things to worry about. Not dying — that was the best gift."
c0dff5e5-e53f-45de-b22b-51c15f337166: "During our last encounter, the mongrels didn't cry black tears when you called them."
52df72bc-7d55-43e7-ad7b-620cd234a8e2: "Dyra? That dirty bitch... We'll have to visit her before we go to Lann. I'll tickle her pretty face with my knife, and she'll tell us everything about our boy's plans."
1b1e858a-04f6-40e5-b241-d63d08b6d3c4: "Ending things will be better for both of us."
76638088-0c34-4d0a-beda-0f3ee06ef4e7: "Even you, the strongest warriors of the tribe, don't dare challenge me. Because you are my army! And you know that I bring blood and death to my enemies." {n}Wenduag ostentatiously ignores the mongrel standing opposite her — large and wiry, covered with scars.{/n} "Those who do not obey me…"
1f5e6fa7-dc12-41a3-b365-ef7df2ee0c68: "Everyone has a right to some fun every now and then." {n}Wenduag's eyes roll back dreamily.{/n}
d7c420ad-aba7-4e68-bc47-f0c5f1565306: "Everything just seems fairer in the caves — when there isn't enough food for the weak, they die. The lazy die. The sick — in the head and the body — die. Only the strong and the skilled survive, and the blood becomes thicker, tougher."
21544ba3-265a-462c-9ef9-204da81e2b10: "Everything that happened between us is in the past. From now on, we are comrades-in-arms, nothing more."
2042b64a-8e2c-4e9b-851c-b6b3e21599b9: "Exactly! How can you enjoy life if your only goal is to kill everything in your path?"
f97b4b9a-cb6a-43eb-9122-d2ca42ceb234: "Excellent. The future has no place for weaklings. Those whose bodies can't handle the wounds will die and stop burdening us with their presence. And the rest will become stronger and tougher, hardened. I am culling my tribe."
f663da48-0359-417c-9812-68b7c322e108: "Exile... So, you're letting me go? I guess you don't need me anymore. As you wish... but I'll never forget today, the day you wounded my pride. I will not forgive you, and I will not forget. And I will not give up. Remember that."
08479d04-7cc1-45a3-ab5c-d707947846ee: "Fine, I understand. I guess you're right. Forgive me. I will do my best not to anger you and not to cause you any more trouble. Thank you for sparing my pride and not chastising me in front of everyone... {mf|master|mistress}." {n}The last drops of playful mischief disappear from Wenduag's voice. The bow she offers is stilted and speaks of weariness.{/n} "If you don't mind, I'll leave now."
15847ac6-b656-4c78-891a-ada3366197f0: "Fine, as you wish. But if you change your mind, I'm always willing to listen."
1eee306e-f93d-421a-8e17-081bf933cf8e: "First, I visited the Ten Thousand Delights — that place is a true kingdom of pleasure! The demons who work there are willing to do anything, literally anything! Wine flows like water, and the incubi, oh... Then I got into a fight with some jumped-up tiefling, and we were thrown out."
18cf0860-fe24-47ef-b5fa-958511d3448c: "First, I'll repay you for letting me live by slaughtering all the demons in the Worldwound. And then I will look for a new source of power instead of the one {g|Savamelekh}Savamelekh's{/g} poison promised us. For uplanders, victory will mean peace, but for us it will be just the beginning of our own war. We will have to fight for our right to live, our right to be among you. And I'm going to need all the power I can get to lead my people in that fight."
c389441c-28bf-4599-95ab-14362ef8bd5a: "For a start, I will help you destroy all the demons left in the Worldwound. As long as they're here, neathers will never be safe — we are just tools to them, things created by one of their own. As for what will happen after the victory... Another war, I think. Neathers deserve their own land, their own piece of the surface. But no one is going to give it to us without a fight. So I'll have to use force to get it for my people."
fd8fc1c7-8c46-4f18-a114-9560f8b4ad8e: "For people like you and me, survival comes at a cost. We live because others die. Every day, we draw breath because someone else has breathed their last. An ally who covered us with their body, an enemy who fell to our blade... How many living souls have you sent to their deaths? It is a number beyond counting. So I was just following your example, {mf|master|mistress}. I simply wanted to learn from you, and eventually surpass you... But it seems I wasn't as good a pupil as I thought."
2d774274-44e9-4f5b-9769-eeaa9375a58a: "Forget about it. You are who you are."
827dbb0a-9792-40b1-a56e-89145c9dd76b: "Forget about them, they're not worth another moment of our attention."
f6394199-f295-42ca-acc2-edff1c82ae23: "Forgive me, {mf|master|mistress}, I shouldn't have asked you to do this. I showed unacceptable weakness, and it will never happen again. You know, I think we should stop our bed games from now on. They make us both too soft, and that's no good. I'm sure you'll find a replacement for me in no time."
88ac25b9-2a80-436c-94d8-8a9d2030fc89: "Get lost. I never want to see you again."
330fe297-73c9-4e1a-b120-a232e60c3fd2: "Give her a dozen lashes, and let that be the end of it."
b7a879b7-029f-49d8-8c60-654a295c7fce: "Go hunting? For what? There's nothing to hunt here!"
e858788a-91a6-48ed-bd5b-ff606b387e37: "Godsh grant, they'll figure it out... I'm afraid we'll lose the tribe one by one like thish, Commander."
d15f5c7c-7ef2-4699-8bf2-03e54bc7c40a: "Good to know! Now stop trying to get under my skin," {n}she huffs, relief plain on her face.{/n}
a6aceb42-0766-4d57-a864-459b4aa688c7: "Goodbye, Commander." {n}Dyra returns to staring into the incredibly high sky above her head.{/n}
6424ad79-2249-4ae0-8a1f-49a69316e51d: "Guilt for your ancestors' betrayal rests with you now. You will have to shed a lot of demon blood to wash it away."
3513c8af-cef9-42d6-99d7-f6d18eb3aac9: "Ha, no. He never stood a chance — I saw the rat chew right through his spine. But he did have a nice axe and a decent bow on him when he died, and the tribe can't afford to lose good weapons. You need weapons to hunt for food. So, I didn't go after the rat to save a friend, I went to get back the axe and bow. And that's what I did."
9f56d0e4-9e62-4e56-9d28-dfb752be9e77: "Ha, of course, you'd know all about being treated like a savage! But you've been such a goody-two-shoes for so many years, they've forgiven you your skin color and your fangs, right?" {n}At Wenduag's mocking words, Irabeth's features twist in an angry grimace.{/n} "But that's not my way! I'm not going to go scrabbling on my belly before a bunch of uplanders, begging for their approval. I'll grab every one of you by the throat and force you to respect me."
61c2a616-90d0-46cf-9d4f-b630968c101b: "Ha, so he's afraid. Pissing his pants, scrambling for help. Nothing will save him from my knife! And I'll punish anyone who helps him! Got that, trader?"
2c43a451-aa0d-426f-98ff-11870097f760: "Ha, where has this lack of trust come from? Am I some kind traitor or something?" {n}A little smile flickers on her lips.{/n} "No, there is no danger for you here... although, a little blood may be spilled either way."
8aa0574a-c444-4a15-b837-c3dc9bf9eb2b: "Ha. You think I'm afraid of them? If they decide to mess with me again, you'll hear about it soon enough — that bitch Irabeth will come running to you to complain that I've stabbed someone else!"
2ceab802-fbf5-483e-acf6-90c78d7db693: "Hah, he's a devious one, don't underestimate him. If he doesn't want to join the crusade for some reason, he'll tell the hunters to scatter throughout the caves, hiding in the darkest crevices. The tribes will disperse and it'll take us years to round them up again. No. No matter how repellent I find it, we need his support... But there are very different ways of getting it." {n}Wenduag pointedly plays with her weapon.{/n}
efe3c6e2-9691-46cb-b8ba-f49725d3d0e6: "Have the mongrels settled on the surface all right?"
4f1a17c3-ca7e-4cc8-9213-6cb20f1647ec: "Have you already decided what you'll do after we win?"
a60915b0-1d6d-493f-88f7-8e66200b5cc9: "Have you gone to anyone for help?"
0c5a8ac1-748a-42c5-813c-e9dc40b80d88: "Have you had many lovers before me?"
76f62049-415d-4c26-9035-cbd9d1ae37b3: "Have you recovered from the fight with Savamelekh?"
2d3fcb8f-2ba6-4930-9002-a82b83dd0bf3: "Have you seen how proud they are of their weakness? 'Look, my hands are so soft, I've never done anything with them in my entire life, because noble blood runs through my veins!' What does it matter who someone's parents are? I'm the daughter of a former chief of the tribe, so what? Is this what they respect and fear me for? Sull became the chief because he was old, experienced, and smart. After him, I might become the chief, because I'm strong and even smarter. But these weaklings wouldn't have lasted a day in our caves..."
6ec8d9b8-8654-4dca-b73f-d2ed9ee756d9: "Have you started searching for Savamelekh yet? With his blood, your warriors will be invincible."
7f63b49b-0984-4db9-9992-e8eb6f39b25e: "He is alive only thanks to your mercy, {mf|master|mistress}. If you hadn't spared him, I'd have hung him upside down and gutted him like a cave lizard."
3b17ec7d-f223-40bc-a5d0-fef8015d39dc: "He is here! I can feel him! And these gates... Their locks are made of the bones of my tribesfolk and will only open to someone from my tribe! {g|Savamelekh}Savamelekh{/g} is hiding here!"
6dde2e1e-0946-4eb8-8884-6d527022380d: "He promised me immortality, and a place by his side. My people are cursed with short lifespans, but I would be eternal. I would become Savamelekh's most favored servant. My people would live in his kingdom and I would be their queen. I would conquer neighboring territories and collect tribute from the uplanders. I would punish and rule as I saw fit... And then, who knows? Perhaps, Savamelekh would grow powerful enough to become a demon lord, and I would be his archpriestess."
77d3d5b2-d24b-49b7-8732-d26938ef618d: "He proved to be weak, but you are not. Be happy about that."
32d0c314-6650-4148-a0ef-a1c2e159d64e: "He squealed like you wouldn't believe... All the young rats in the caves were mourning the loss of those gray family jewels that night." {n}With her eyes half-closed, Wenduag savors the pleasant memories.{/n} "It was dying for half a gong, tried to get on its feet again six times, the long-toothed beast, but I just knocked it back down on the rocks till it finally kicked the bucket. And only then could I get my arm out of its maw. No one in the tribe had ever done anything like that before... No one."
604ac67d-748c-4b81-bbee-f06cd70b4b24: "He was important. He made people listen to him without raising his voice. He knew how to lead. I followed him around everywhere, especially after my mother died. But he kept his distance from everyone... even me. He never let anyone forget that he was a chief. I decided that I wanted to be like him when I grew up. But now... I don't think I ever really understood him."
91fac862-247a-4abd-9e23-6bf1a8a71886: "He was... I don't remember. The last time I saw him, it was so many gongs ago... I know more about him from the stories of others. He was a tough chief, a skilled hunter, a good husband. He..." {n}The huntress pauses, and then, looking you straight in the eye, says reluctantly,{/n} "He was big. In my memories he's always been the biggest and the strongest."
3546559e-8f74-4905-8e49-f53ce2f53a5c: "He wasn't lying, I can sense it. When he talked, it's like I was there, I tasted the meat, that poison on my tongue... I think it actually happened. Our traditions have always been harsh, and now I understand better where they stem from."
c583a899-b229-4469-8080-6074d04e7385: "He went hunting and never came back. It happens. I cried for so many gongs. I just couldn't stop. Our healer said that I nearly died from grief — I couldn't breathe... I refused to move. I just lay there like a corpse... I couldn't understand why he had abandoned me. I mean, I knew what death was back then, but I hadn't come to terms with what it meant. He was my whole world, and... I couldn't forgive him for leaving me." {n}Wenduag sighs heavily.{/n}
6a68ced2-95cc-4792-86c8-8cdd73dd00b6: "He's telling the truth. I can sense that my tribe has changed. Their blood runs thick and hot in their veins, their hearts are pounding in their chests..."
6a126cdf-e285-409a-a76f-60061fa612c1: "Hepzamirah's servants are skilled at luring people into treachery. But you're no traitor... Right, Wenduag?"
dd395d57-bcaf-4e0e-8b43-53cdced25813: "Here on the surface we use more... romantic ways to show our affection."
0ddd0904-4e1e-457c-b12d-2dc96a98f6a0: "Hmm... Caution is good." {n}Wenduag looks upon the body of the legendary warrior without any deference or regret.{/n}
75e7c018-0e6c-4667-a16d-89c2ae4b1ba0: "How about a kiss for good luck?"
f4210220-ff4f-4e3d-bbb2-004ad4da8dac: "How are you going to turn the mongrels into the invincible soldiers you promised me?"
eaafd3e3-5917-4d8a-82e5-cfb05bf11481: "How dare you take people's lives on a whim?"
d50395de-cafb-4282-90d0-25fe35ed8119: "How dare you! You... You are my creation! You are my slave!"
482bffa3-98aa-49b0-bc51-b2102e99b2cf: "How long do we have before we shtarve to death or wild animalsh eat ush up..."
e4003830-0312-425c-b82b-f8fa921cf5bc: "How were you able to sense Savamelekh?"
6e6744cc-fcd6-45ed-918a-d77a87ed6f56: "However, I have a lot on my plate at the moment, and the book must be guarded well, since people are willing to kill for it. Take it and make sure no one else suffers because of it. Got it?"
de141b56-371d-4bd0-a0f4-f72be78103f7: "I am excited, but not in the way you think. I want to offer you something even more valuable than the pleasure of my touch." {n}You hear the huntress's low, sultry laugh.{/n}
b8526d60-c850-4bb7-a07f-fc5738445097: "I am glad that even your thirst for power has its limits... Forgive me, that sounded like sarcasm, but I truly am glad."
013a4279-4628-46bc-8878-e052db270f74: "I am not going to execute you. But you will have to make amends for your crimes... and after everything you've done, that will take a long, long time."
b9dd6537-6bd0-48f6-8a74-fbe82229efdf: "I am not going to explain myself to you. Leave."
1ce96ffe-c028-42b4-9713-3f5d6932769f: "I am sorry that you had to go through all of that."
dca50bd6-5bed-4ef9-80c7-9789fa0ae8a4: "I am trying to survive, like I always do. I submit to power to avoid being crushed."
1df6c330-c612-43f3-990f-32686cacc746: "I apologize again, {mf|master|mistress}. I deeply regret my actions!" {n}The huntress's self-satisfied smile makes it clear that she regrets nothing.{/n}
0b57a6e2-965d-41e1-85fe-bec59a423447: "I brought my kin to their lair, so they could join the demon army and accept the power given to them. I made my tribe stronger! Later, once we no longer needed the demons, my powerful kin would have fought for me." {n}The huntress shoots you a grim and bloodthirsty grin.{/n}
07918527-c9f0-4ea2-a311-13d6a9882126: "I can guarantee you fun and entertainment!"
2c3578d9-d9ae-4ad6-bed2-f5d995c5cd12: "I can hardly believe it myself... All my life, survival has been my only priority. But now... I don't want to survive without you."
a784a8c4-f873-4680-892b-d26b2b0f7e52: "I can tell you're proud of your strength."
13f40a61-5a58-4285-88c5-dede4be507c8: "I can't allow you to suffer from the cold. Come with me, I'll warm you up."
66b8af1f-cae4-4fdf-857e-9f3dbd9a25d9: "I can't believe I just said that..." {n}Wenduag stares at you for a moment in stunned silence. Then she giggles happily.{/n} "But I do love you, {name}. I really do."
74dceb30-a7e1-4d35-94a9-b199bf882358: "I can't help you with that right now."
249fbc97-924f-4911-b5cb-8007cc98b0f8: "I coped this time, I'll do it again! Don't insult me with your distrust! I've just proved that I'm the strongest of your warriors, and even Savamelekh's poison couldn't get the better of me!"
5a8c2b01-c8b9-44b0-96e9-b8013a0fd439: "I could satisfy more than that, {mf|master|mistress}." {n}With a smile full of promise, Wenduag lashes you lightly on the thigh with her tail.{/n}
09eb10ee-36e0-45f1-97d9-20d2edcabb16: "I dare not deny the right of any mortal to slay anyone whose mug he or she finds ugly. It is a very compelling reason, after all."
1d6379c4-1b4f-4158-b1b5-c0e10201c777: "I didn't choose you for your looks."
9af48b13-98e7-4a64-bd56-df1f1358229a: "I didn't even see you get wounded."
cfcacf42-9855-4621-bd45-1c6c151b22c7: "I didn't know what I was doing, {mf|master|mistress}! Savamelekh's poison... That's what it was! I was drugged!"
76c36ffe-2a85-435f-b272-98ae53e410ff: "I didn't notice either. It was just a scratch, it didn't even hurt, so I didn't pay any attention to it. And then overnight it started swelling, and I developed a fever. The infection is spreading, and none of the potions I've used made a difference."
8d7cf58c-25f7-48fa-aaa6-d7b3a1bd8643: "I didn't want the others to see me howling in pain when it's being treated. It would be humiliating." {n}Wenduag's tail lashes her knees nervously, and she stares at you intensely.{/n}
38f9df41-d7c5-4192-9822-e91627ba36ec: "I do not understand why Areelu abandoned this laboratory but did not destroy it. She opened the Worldwound but did not cover her tracks!"
151c4c5b-119a-46ce-8d63-d4dbcceab337: "I don't care about what other people think. You're beautiful."
4db446b3-a023-4103-90eb-7f151dc1d146: "I don't doubt your loyalty. But Alushinyrra is full of temptations — there are plenty of people who would reward you betraying me. But do you know why I don't worry?"
93fd70df-8751-4842-a703-72157ce9b885: "I don't have an answer to your question."
196ae3d3-3a87-4210-8c21-cdaace1aaf7c: "I don't have time to chat with you."
17e1af7d-d172-4d84-b071-e35383b0f4db: "I don't have time to comfort you."
d90c1845-92dd-488d-958b-a6459c4d6e05: "I don't have time to search every mansion in the area for him."
52c73022-2020-4319-acb0-01a8c563f43b: "I don't know what awaits us either. I look into the future, but all I see is darkness, and all I smell is blood."
7f8f88fd-7a3d-4e18-8601-2f8aff17c4c9: "I don't know what lies ahead, or what the future holds. But I know that we'll be together, no matter what happens. And if we have to face Pharasma — we'll stand before her side by side."
3dc7b87c-14c9-4180-8efa-c36722170f6d: "I don't know, {mf|master|mistress}. Savamelekh made us who we are... but now he's dead, and all his plots and plans are gone with him. We'll have to survive on our own now — without the protection of the Shield Maze. But we are no longer cursed with short lifespans. So who knows? Perhaps we'll manage to claim a piece of land on the surface. Maybe we can settle there, and create a kingdom of our own."
c044d11d-b13b-4d4d-8e8d-5d5d0e27fe1e: "I don't know. I did a long time ago, when he went missing... It's hard to bury someone twice in your heart. But it's... bitter." {n}Wenduag turns away.{/n}
b7c387ee-f47f-4be5-b6cc-9b45c7954429: "I don't know... You're not an ordinary mortal. Maybe the poison won't change your appearance. Why? Are you afraid you'll become... a freak?" {n}The huntress narrows her eyes.{/n}
23629338-1d00-4eb8-8a29-5bcaa4dca257: "I don't like the idea of being your neglected girlfriend, so how about we pretend nothing happened between us? You'll be my commander, I'll be your warrior, but someone else can warm your bed. I think that would be best for everyone."
a8db525c-f417-4c53-94e5-13b4a272cd26: "I don't need help from the mongrels."
363f92fa-11e6-42b6-b13a-8b8f129ab488: "I don't think I was ready for this..."
2e124ef5-bc0b-4252-ab97-0759554b25db: "I don't think that will be the last fire you'll see. Only next time, it will be the demons burning!"
4650782b-c949-4029-bcc9-3321782004d2: "I don't want to see you anymore."
24103cac-dbd6-443d-ac49-15a2ae6aa85f: "I don't want you getting into fights with your fellow warriors."
3200fbf1-5aef-4c05-8170-92b2d1400119: "I follow the true master of my people — the invincible Savamelekh! He is a great tempter and conqueror, and his poison grants power and bliss! The time of conquest has come! I'll become his champion, a great queen! And you uplanders will be our slaves!"
2be18c2b-2429-4582-8e5f-043eb11a61a1: "I forbid you to do anything like this ever again. That's an order. You understand?"
45bf615d-3d79-41ac-adf1-5941f4aa1ea3: "I guess I'd be dead then. Better to be dead meat with a clear conscience than to be alive with a heart tainted by treachery."
dba4e4a7-d31b-4a6f-984e-955c84cb692b: "I had never seen so much fire before I came to Kenabres. The smell of smoke seems to follow me everywhere now! But I cannot say that I find the smell... unpleasant."
73c21d25-511a-49a7-b54e-4ba1e90c9be5: "I had no choice. She had her eyes on me from the start, and if I said no, she would have gotten rid of me. The things we do for survival, right? So I had to swallow everything she had for me — her knife play, her whip, her habit of choking me real good before getting down to the main event..." {n}Rolling her shoulders languidly, Wenduag doesn't even try to hide the lust in her voice.{/n} "...It was so horrible."
31c1e201-ae31-4cec-967b-bc0cc5eb890a: "I had to slit several throats to keep my schemes a secret. {g|Dyra}Dyra's{/g} disappearance upset the tribe and the guards made it impossible for me to hide her body. I had to leave her corpse in the middle of the street. At the time, I was worried that I would be discovered and my plot would be exposed. Luckily, however, you weren't interested in investigating the murder."
827face0-f8a6-4108-bb29-effd0ab7dd09: "I have been preparing for a long time, but now I see that without your might, my lord, we will be just a shadow of our true selves! We have no other fate than to be with you! And I bow to you, great Savamelekh, as all my people will soon!"
cdd68daf-7950-408f-a066-cb40a8fad413: "I have nothing to tell you... I'll swear on anything!"
502890a0-525b-407c-91c7-287990069c14: "I have to admit, it wasn't an easy decision. He offered me an extremely tempting reward but... after getting to know you, I realized that I would rather be on your side. I had more to gain from maintaining my allegiance to you."
9c4382fc-72e9-4efa-b690-d689cd41778b: "I hope the delights of Alushinyrra haven't tempted you to forsake me and swear allegiance to Nocticula. I would have to punish you for that."
a0d77587-351b-4f51-a05a-177b503c3c8e: "I hope this will be a lesson to you. Play at being queen if you like, but don't forget your place."
2b3d6fd1-3fc2-430f-8107-d208f28bb1e9: "I hope your warriors are worth all this effort."
d2d8534b-3197-46f6-b732-cd596a16e2ce: "I know I can be difficult sometimes, but you still managed to find the right approach and the right words to reach me. It's incredible. I only hope I'll be able to learn from you and become a worthy leader." {n}Her eyes are filled with sincere admiration, without even a hint of subservience or flattery.{/n}
ca424ce4-8a4b-41f0-a5ed-a31b22791340: "I know I'm strong, but what good is that if... " {n}Wenduag stops herself and looks away hastily.{/n}
cd834b75-2307-48b6-86a0-876f57b91073: "I know. It works like a charm on warriors — as soon as they see it, they go soft as putty, because they understand who they are dealing with."
7801b01a-3405-4180-b0bf-97fccc571796: "I know. You didn't disappoint me, either." {n}Her clawed hand runs over your chest without leaving a scratch.{/n}
33ed42f8-6432-45e7-8cf9-1ddb9d9678cf: "I know. You're the only one who understands me. You've got so many people depending on you too..." {n}Wenduag sighs darkly and sinks deeper into her gloomy thoughts.{/n}
58494bc6-0a26-44d6-bd3e-1e6fccf78ba1: "I never tried to comfort you. Comforting words are for weaklings." {n}Wenduag smiles nervously.{/n} "Don't fool yourself. I'm the same wicked, lying, traitorous bitch that I was before. I still don't care about anyone but myself, but I am a little glad that you didn't just drop dead."
c69e7afb-58df-4da0-bb66-ac8f0b3d1a0d: "I reckon you could do it. If you know the right people, meaning demons, you could rise here. But you didn't hear it from me!"
791481d6-c277-4ade-b391-c079d263df9f: "I sense... a stranger." {n}Audibly sniffing the air, Wenduag turns around slowly and sees you. She grins.{/n} "Ah. {mf|Master|Mistress}."
d8741d32-3510-46cd-af8c-74b1851f4719: "I sentence Wenduag to twenty lashes. Let that be a lesson to you."
529eaaf8-7453-4eb0-8944-a6e46eb53f8b: "I spared Lann's life. I'm sure you have an opinion on that."
39b28aa2-3023-4d4c-942e-cd1dc20ee13e: "I suggest we settle our argument with a duel." {n}The hunter looks furiously at Wenduag.{/n} "I'm not a great hero, and I'm not a chief. But I'm not a coward who forgot his responsibility to his tribe either. That's why I'll be waiting for you in our cave, Wenduag. Come, and we'll fight for the future of the tribe. I know you won't stop until someone makes you."
c03d744b-5dec-4277-b101-c5c18c65dc02: "I suppose now is the time to thank you for that. After everything we have gone through together, it's strange to think that I once planned to spend my whole life in those horrible catacombs under Kenabres. I know this won't sound much in the spirit of the crusade, but... betraying Hosilla was the best decision of my life."
e66a987c-2685-4332-ad76-1c981c24351a: "I swear, if Lann succeeds with his 'cure' and deprives my warriors of their demonic rage, I will gut him like a fish! We have to stop him, {mf|master|mistress}!"
e1b122bf-b5ad-4cf9-8434-2c48e4c96ee8: "I think it's time for me to say goodbye."
61133503-4c71-4aec-8d7d-f87a751cf566: "I think we'll find the tribe working hard, preparing for war. After you destroyed the Shield Maze, everyone must have believed that the promised times had come. The surface is calling to the underground crusaders... Well, if that's true, it can only be to our benefit."
1f895cad-99a0-4ef5-9564-39b39c476ca0: "I think you've misunderstood. I really am displeased with you."
8550c3f5-d4e7-47ef-b54d-3236c74c59a2: "I thought you were proud of being strong."
c7172446-a08e-457e-bd5b-da9217253336: "I trusht you. Many othersh do too. But not everyone. And it meansh that if I lead the tribe, our family will be divided. Neathers cannot be divided — that ish how we will die. That'sh why, if we are leaving, we are leaving together."
52dd5880-8f61-4f34-9c8f-ef165f090cca: "I want to clear the air about what happened at the ziggurat. I still care about you."
7fcab769-8ac8-4f2f-98cc-81c4861141f6: "I want to know more about you."
fdb27bb9-68cd-4ffc-8ac6-22c74897515e: "I want to offer you a gift." {n}Wenduag smiles mysteriously, and points to the demon's corpse. There is a fearsome-looking stinger at the end of his tail, and your eyes are drawn to a single bead of poison that glints dangerously at its tip.{/n} "A communion with Savamelekh's poison. It contains immense power, but it is also incredibly dangerous."
0a579449-0d41-4cd7-9502-99e71be3b831: "I wanted to expressh my consherns. I fear for Wenduag. She'sh not as... shtout and tenacioush as she may sheem."
56ba381b-40dd-499a-b930-636a77df9c9a: "I wanted to get rid of you, but I needed the help of a powerful ally. When we arrived in Alushinyrra, I knew Savamelekh was close. I smelled his scent in the city. So I tracked him down. I went to his house and forged an alliance with him. Then I returned to camp as if nothing had happened... and you were none the wiser!"
03fa4459-0ccc-4351-965f-9f6a8e8bcd81: "I wanted to, sure, but not like this." {n}He points at the smiling Wenduag.{/n} "Just look at her. She'll either get us all killed or make us into demons' slaves, and I don't know which is worse."
8fe66383-54c3-4c01-aa64-912f7677b004: "I warned you, Lann. I told you that if you came anywhere near my tribe, I'd make you regret it!"
36582eef-90f8-44f0-aba6-b0dd06d6122c: "I warned you. You can't trust a person who betrays their own tribe. You'd have to be rotten to the core to do something like that."
bf56cc95-9ed9-4c4b-92ad-85a339092690: "I was celebrating my reunion with my tribe, of course. You brought my kin to the surface — doesn't this accomplishment warrant a celebration?"
e6d8085e-458b-4090-bcc3-d08105716f48: "I was curious to see what you'd do, whose side you'd take. And I'm quite pleased with the result. You've proved once again that I was right when I decided to follow you, and that I hold a special place among your fighters."
2c872f90-8eee-410b-8991-34c7bbb723b4: "I was just waiting for you to give the order. Seize her!"
0cf24d70-b5cb-4f06-ae3f-4b02cdd40a72: "I was only serving the demons because they promised me power — and only for as long as they had something to offer me." {n}Wenduag chuckles, revealing her sharp teeth.{/n} "But Hosilla can't offer me anything now she's dead, and I was never going to risk my life for her. You are a true leader, one worth following!" {n}the huntress says in a fawning tone.{/n}
bf2821ad-ce10-4dc9-a236-c5113d539dc9: "I was plotting against you from day one, but you were shrewd enough to catch me in the act... and wise enough to let me go. You subdued my fighters, and you discovered that I was responsible for {g|Dyra}Dyra's{/g} murder. However, you refused to send me to the gallows. Instead, you showed me that my schemes would never succeed — no matter what I did, you would always be one step ahead."
4543cdfe-1d4e-445a-ba3d-98dde3b8a540: "I was showered with praise and compliments, the best hunters of the other tribes wanted me — but what did that matter to me? The moment you start listening to flattery is the moment you get soft and you die. No, I always pushed myself further, challenging myself, taking myself to the very edge. Many times, I almost died, but I always came back stronger. I earned all my strength on my own, and if anyone didn't respect that, I just grabbed my knife! That's why I became the best hunter in the tribe."
11107cc7-9655-47ac-aff4-1884fa0b2db1: "I was so touched by your support... It was unusual to hear you offer up such gentle words of comfort."
38dddea8-0d76-40bb-9fba-9dc864560abd: "I wasn't trying to kill you. Please, you have to believe me. I would never betray you. I'm loyal to you, and I'll remain loyal forever. I swear." {n}Wenduag's voice sounds thin and fragile, like a twig frozen by the winter winds.{/n}
4ebb285b-68b4-4a9e-a801-7af9ffd6c374: "I will always be bound to my tribe. Those ties will remain forever. I am a mongrel from the Neathholm tribe, and I will never be anyone else. The fate of my tribe is my fate as well."
b819d2d8-48b3-402f-9d86-65854f476541: "I will find out what happened to her."
f14b68eb-73ae-456f-9cb5-341c7bd8b889: "I will only say this once: those who do not obey me will die."
5fc08fbf-3821-4112-9fbd-b94c9459c257: "I will serve you and only you with loyalty and devotion! I swear it! I swear!"
ab6e66b2-d64f-4ee0-a647-03514bda5434: "I won't abandon you like your father did. I promise."
2946674b-f0d7-4e50-b1c6-ff4e0a8d23d5: "I won't be able to help you."
58d212b7-8823-4780-9e8e-9b236c4950b3: "I won't execute you, but I never want to see you again. Now get out of my sight."
1d33b7f2-73b5-484f-a1c2-d14df850f7dc: "I won't leave, and I don't have time to convince you, Lann. So what are we going to do?"
c042b943-5ba7-460e-9a79-556bdcedd6fa: "I'd be glad to have you as my companion."
95ce85e9-784b-4cb1-b940-a77c03cae779: "I'd like to believe you, but the fact you relied on Wenduag's help says more about you than any words could. She can't wait to turn all the mongrels into a howling horde, crushing the enemy at her command!"
44e4c102-828d-4797-8a77-7e92a4ac20bc: "I'd much rather give him a few good kicks up the — but, as you wish." {n}With a contented smile, Wenduag bows before you.{/n}
79f6a5bc-1541-4132-96c8-1f8235a01807: "I'd rather live for myself than die for Golarion."
e915bf4e-7822-4787-b16e-c8856ee08521: "I'll be gentle." {n}Wenduag tears the poisonous stinger from Savamelekh's tail, and brings it over to you. She caresses your skin with the stinger, delicately placing it against your chest. Then she presses down carefully until its tip pierces your skin.{/n}
5f24e326-4e13-42e9-be47-96adeb529e44: "I'll chain you to my throne like tamed beasts! And I'll rip the tongue out of anyone stupid enough to open their filthy mouth."
a116fc93-66a7-4e3c-8345-5418da16fa5c: "I'll go and sabotage the war effort. I'll destroy everything you've worked so hard to build. So if you don't want me to ruin your entire campaign, you'd better not die." {n}Wenduag tries to adopt a playful tone as she teases you about the crusade, but she can't hide the worry in her voice.{/n}
d8cd7b46-b768-4948-802f-fd3ead5b9ede: "I'll just order him to do it. He'll hardly disregard a direct order from the crusade commander, right?"
735dd8c4-157c-4c55-b7f9-0c369c6b549b: "I'll repeat my question: what's going on here?"
02e9975e-c588-450a-92ec-74621f464390: "I'll try. Just don't expect me to stop being a bitch overnight. This leopard will need some time to change her spots."
014dea54-93cd-4bbf-b185-ade0e142287d: "I'm glad you were able to overcome Savamelekh's poison."
b6debfdf-5a34-4714-8e1a-10feb769dca0: "I'm great! What do you want from me?" {n}Wenduag folds her arms on her chest, indicating that the conversation is over.{/n}
94ef2705-c597-4176-b858-a9b7c18a15e8: "I'm not a good... girl..." {n}A growl catches in the huntress's throat. Oily tears seep from Wenduag's eyes, painting her face with glistening black streaks. She lets out an inarticulate, crazed howl.{/n}
5edd0fde-fa7c-4fad-b761-7d7438d7acba: "I'm not used to seeing you so serious and responsible."
8c394a8b-8675-4476-9951-ecd9687a6e3b: "I'm saying this only because I care about you. I don't want to lose you, so I beg you — please show a little restraint next time."
acbb0e06-87ad-403f-9327-646c92e5b6e7: "I'm sorry. They should know that many of our ways are new to you."
52ada367-6166-4aae-b4c8-3718ddc398e7: "I'm staking no claim on your heart, and I have no aspirations of becoming your betrothed. I'm simply suggesting that we have some fun." {n}Wenduag's laughter sounds playful and carefree.{/n}
5938c81c-7559-4863-88cf-b42df38984aa: "I'm sure that your tribe has a bright future ahead of it. Let's imagine what it will be like together."
f0b84666-4fbf-4b5f-8bf7-b213d847b8b5: "I'm the chief. I hear the steps of those who follow my lead."
3d066881-1166-4636-8d8a-af448a439444: "I've been thinking a lot about what you said to me back in that cave... And I guess I understand now. I was too focused on myself. I was striving to find a heroic destiny for myself, trying to become something more than just a guy with a bow... but I failed to realize that I have always been a part of something bigger. I belong to a tribe, a community, and I have no right to dictate what the other members of my tribe should do, or what fate they choose. I may not always agree with my tribe, but it is my duty to serve them."
acc81732-2724-4226-afad-c6d50095c9a8: "I've been training the Neathholm fighters from the moment they joined your army. I taught them to obey me and me alone. When the time came, they were going to turn on your crusaders and stab them in their sleep. Did you know about that? No, you didn't."
71d7e894-a350-4a77-ac44-5daae808c2b9: "I've never... loved anyone before. But if you're stupid enough to die, I'll follow you to Pharasma's judgment." {n}There's a sudden tightness in Wenduag's voice, like a bowstring stretched to its breaking point.{/n}
77c8c7e1-5a4e-418a-a550-43bd8300a165: "I've told you already that I'm not always good at getting along with uplanders. That story with the tieflings and the dagger... That wasn't a one-off, let's put it that way."
e4f19e57-5eb2-4515-ac24-a13e1334d182: "If I need a rope made of your guts to drag the neathers up to the surface, I'll be happy to make it!"
cc9b343e-cb88-4cef-9576-b63f808c31b0: "If I see your mongrels disrespecting me again, I'll cut off something of yours in full view of them. To strengthen my authority."
7f4e29d6-53e2-4039-8d2a-0ed787d78275: "If a reward was owed for Baphomet's head and Nocticula had claimed it, then I could understand your frustration. As it is, what she did was not very polite, but nothing more than that. We've suffered no financial loss."
d7801e77-9260-4b6c-a616-f218003a1064: "If one of us doesn't survive this battle, just know — I love you and I always will."
e05f9b89-00bf-4fe6-b9f0-9dc80c356986: "If that's true... they don't understand what kind of prey they've caught! Let them lure me in, I'll happily walk into their trap!"
b6441b2c-652e-4944-9038-44b1fb12cf11: "If they've decided to follow you, if this is the future they've chosen — then I'll walk that path with them. So, if your army needs a decent bowman, Commander... I'm at your service."
0b4549ba-1c53-4947-8f10-9cd935632568: "If we're both alive, I'm going to drag you off to some out-of-the-way nook and we'll celebrate our victory on our own. Again and again and again."
e011d25b-5fba-4873-bd98-a7eeaf848e7b: "If you are only realizing that now, you are far less perceptive than you think."
11fd2566-0f33-44f7-8b54-9cc2cc84c25e: "If you cared so much about your tribe, why did you abandon them when they left Neathholm? You weren't there for them when they needed you most."
4f7b00f8-cb37-447f-a62d-2c9825dcdbcc: "If you don't know, I'm not going to tell you."
4220de69-8b05-4a31-9460-e814755e59a1: "If you got what you wanted, you'd have chewed us all up by now! No, I think you should stay just the way you are."
df72689b-817b-4248-a5ca-1f6d0e207d76: "If you stand in my way, you will regret it."
349ef4a3-9ef9-4712-87cd-5a4a718def17: "If you want to go rot in dank caves — then leave! If you're afraid you're going to hurt someone — then slit your own throat! I don't need a bunch of weak, pathetic nobodies following me around! But if you have fire in your veins, and anger in your heart, then you can join my pack. I'll lead you into battle. We will bathe ourselves in the blood of our enemies! We will win glory and renown, and the right to live our lives as we see fit! The road will be dark and dangerous, but I will lead you into the future!"
f5f9715f-bd6c-4a4d-b800-f9b744ee78f7: "If you wish to leave, you're free to go. I don't need you."
4ea4b6b2-3209-4cdf-b6cc-1e438bb71d62: "In that case, I'll arrest her immediately. If she were a soldier of the crusade army, she would be facing a tribunal for murder. But since she is your companion, I will have to make do with a lighter punishment — two dozen lashes. And, of course, she'll be barred from entering the tavern again." {n}Irabeth salutes you resolutely.{/n}
d549c459-988b-4e9e-8234-2a635f42e79c: "Is he hoping for an honest fight? What an idiot! Let's deal with him quietly and without any witnesses."
b4825aa4-72cc-4286-b633-45adf5374066: "Is seeing the sky strange for you?"
28bf2790-8419-466f-a0fc-e5ed6d430bb7: "It jumped at me, jaws snapping — and the next thing I see is my whole arm disappearing into its maw. My spear got smashed to pieces, and the chunk of wood that I was holding in my hand got stuck inside its throat. The beast was wheezing, writhing, hopping around me on its hind legs, trying to bite my arm off, but I just held the wood of my spear tighter while I groped for the knife on my belt. And as soon as I did — I sank the blade deep into that old rat's crotch."
c15dbe12-f799-44f7-840c-1833bccfb73e: "It looks like you finally believe in love."
aae5567e-8917-4c68-9f5d-6c54ad3a7f6b: "It must have been difficult to see your father like that... I'm sure it stirred up a lot of painful emotions."
1d5bac51-01e7-4638-9af0-4c89ec30c0bf: "It was one tough dire rat, as big as horses are up here on the surface. It was old, cunning and vicious, we'd never met the likes of it before... Another neather and I ran into it when we were scouting some distant caves. The rat snatched the guy first and dragged him into its burrow, and I rushed after them. I cornered it in a cramped little cave, and I yelled and singed its whiskers with my torch — I got it nicely riled up, in short."
ae7b99f3-b09f-4b49-b7d4-749b8250e244: "It will be a miracle if we survive... but I've seen you perform plenty of miracles. I just have to trust you."
1b5ede22-5afa-4b64-8952-dd70913c5770: "It worked... You're still alive." {n}Wenduag, who has been staring at you worriedly, laughs in relief. Her lips are bruised and bleeding, and you taste the iron tang of blood on your lips as well.{/n}
b69c2936-4f8e-4dd3-882a-5c64b6fd6541: "It's a cryin' shame about the town, but it was a tough place for an enterprisin' thief to find his feet. It's time to conquer new heights and all that stuff!"
6fd0d016-854d-4e96-86c6-1787d7e9d43f: "It's a dangerous book. Dangerous, because Dyra was killed for it. Take it and keep it safe. If anyone else's blood is shed because of it, it will be on you. Got it?"
5495507e-541a-4b62-9da9-1794a4091a44: "It's good that our paths crossed. You could need a good servant, and I need a strong {mf|master|mistress}."
b2eb2436-31f2-4f3f-a9e3-db8d6c27c8c2: "It's not that I don't want to... Quite the opposite. But my blood is up lately, I'm afraid I won't be able to restrain myself... and I might take things too far." {n}Wenduag's playful tone can't conceal the tension ringing in her voice.{/n}
06400be7-206d-4943-ad95-cad72a4ac75f: "It's not up to us to judge them. We weren't in their position."
e194ded3-3e0a-42a3-b1ef-8c9ef2302877: "It's time. Let's show them what the underground crusaders are made of."
5c3094d3-3982-4cf1-8211-2e852cbe6430: "It's unlikely the other races will accept you. You will settle in the desolate lands reclaimed from the demons."
1441375b-b91d-4132-969c-962457fa9899: "It'sh hard for them... The sky, the sun, open shpaces — all this ish new to them. Many of them are scared, keep close to the ground, look for burrowsh to hide in... But our new mighty chief doesn't leave them the right to be scared."
b1e6d4e1-9aba-4502-93ef-19a9a8fbf039: "Join them? After all the defeats we inflicted upon them, {mf|master|mistress}? Why would I switch to the losing side?"
364b728f-bb0c-432b-beeb-0690a4012ff8: "Join us, Lann. I thought you wanted to go up to the surface with all the mongrels."
e4ac877b-c70b-4bb6-a273-d9ae581fdc73: "Just like many others — he went hunting and disappeared. That kind of thing is common in the caves. We didn't know it was because of Savamelekh's servants, not wild predators. And then, when I served Hosilla, I wasn't... let in on the secret." {n}A grim silence hangs after Wenduag's words, filled with the promise of a cruel death.{/n}
101c3d2c-476c-41e5-9f87-98782fb94cf5: "Just say the word, {mf|master|mistress}, and I'll make them beg forgiveness for their insubordination. They've grown soft under Savamelekh's rule. They've forgotten what I taught them about obedience. I can't wait to remind them."
26bcad2f-6e35-45e3-b327-063d28a6f34e: "Just to be on the safe side."
f7f7efd2-e4a9-4edb-bd62-3f19caa23d83: "Kill for me, and you will get everything you've been dreaming of."
f07fc87a-c914-49ff-bbef-d7d1bc5d89d6: "Kill your creator, Wenduag! And his strength will be yours!"
cec8da65-df99-42fe-a896-1b03085cb118: "Lann, come to your senses. I don't wish any harm on the mongrels."
2e89296e-c5a9-448f-8212-6fe20891d97b: "Let's be honest. We stay together because we are useful to each other. We have an arrangement. You grant me power, and I kill for you. But it has always been about survival — not friendship, or anything else. I will always strive for more, I will always seek power... and that's beneficial for you. After all, the stronger your servants are, the more useful they will be to you."
8181c85b-bd35-4660-9f8e-f73bfbda12ba: "Let's get out of here. We still have a lot to do — the Worldwound won't defeat itself."
8579021d-92ad-4a64-b20d-4b850256a9f0: "Let's pay a visit to Neathholm, then."
a821a87f-0e57-48c7-b8af-d55226f28dd2: "Let's talk. Sull said you needed my support."

I feel sorry for the fools who laugh at you and don't realize your jokes are proof of your limitless power."
242813f9-08ad-42e6-bafe-a67c7e5af3b9: "Someone is eavesdropping on us!" {n}Stopping immediately, Wenduag listens intently, turning around and noticing you. She grins.{/n} "Ah. {mf|Master|Mistress}."
d0f047f1-9f16-4aa2-8f02-44409ecc0726: "Sorry, Commander, but I'm afraid I must decline your offer. I haven't redeemed myself in the eyes of my tribe, so I must return to exile. ea7b7b59-e29c-4b2b-a787-20a5503a3854: "Sounds sensible. Even if you fear nothing and no one, there's no reason to leave evidence at the scene of the crime."
03ae3444-4ba7-4687-8573-ce925c983347: "Sssscrew the damned stories! Screw the cursed hunting! It hurts! Are you trying to kill me, or what?"
a75d3d94-c478-4497-bdeb-b4db367c5536: "Stop fooling around. I'm not in the mood for jokes."
9a65d6c9-00d2-4ee0-bb10-65c801e8091c: "Stop sniveling and be strong, like before. Or else I'll start to wonder if I picked a wimp to be my companion."
3c6bf6f0-19f1-4d35-93d2-6ca7b90f324f: "Stop thinking you can solve everything on your own. You need to learn to open your heart to others."
45c81a99-eb2f-4814-b80d-7e957ef86b17: "Strange timesh. Let the young make new roadsh for the tribe in the new world. Although, of course, I never pictured Wenduag as my successor..."
23bbcb49-a41a-4f36-bc4c-10988da0a799: "Such a dishaster... Wenduag turned the tribe against the uplandersh... Led ush into treachery. Our kind will die, none of ush will be left, and only I, the old fool, am left here to bury the dead. Thish ish the end..."
4a449b45-2c7d-4091-b311-831b37f6ef41: "Sull, do you think Wenduag is a bad chief?"
2d4ed958-b05e-451c-922a-549dce7488f2: "Summon a healer, Wenduag wishes to do battle with some goddesses. With two at once, my sweet, or are you going to be sensible and take them on one at a time?"
ea5097f0-4dce-48ba-b804-9ab7959dcb21: "Sure, there is less food in the caves than here. But... the amount of food the uplanders have — it's too much. We only had one fat person in our tribe, and that was Sull, and he was only fat because he was old. But up here..."
cc70f0ba-5623-49fc-8f75-4640d16ee470: "Take care of her. Talk to her. Don't make her go through thish alone."
c61e9daa-5878-4fd2-8edd-993b27016ae0: "Tell me a story. How did you learn to hunt?"
4ff99f21-b4c5-466e-ba63-7b8561c63ee3: "Tell me about your life in the caves."
645eb2a0-b7ba-41e4-b188-fdda4703c7e2: "Tell me what Lann wanted, or you'll talk to Wenduag."
196e0c3a-39b2-4544-b362-46806a6cf9e5: "Thank you for stepping in, Commander. And... good luck. I hope you manage to knock some sense into her stubborn head. I'm sure it won't be easy."
714661c2-36c4-4016-9dba-4e9c2952accc: "Thank you, Commander, but I don't deserve your kind words. The Neathholm tribe will survive because of you — not me."
15be75b1-b9f6-49e8-894b-19a111d18ac2: "Thank you, Commander. I'll try not to fail you or my kin ever again."
90c61be9-2107-47c7-8535-9cf587fccf7c: "Thank you, I knew you would undershtand. I should have come to you right away. But I was afraid, old slug that I am. You are so important, so much depends on you, you probably think our troublesh are so petty..."
ccf1379a-1a20-4533-a4db-389def51c3a9: "Thank you, {mf|master|mistress}! You are always so understanding!"
2c5cf761-95d2-43ef-bc61-1be736ee2f87: "That army of mongrels you promised me would be useful right about now."
7713cc29-a6f5-46d8-ab06-a87a32ac3719: "That bitch Nocticula stole our victory over Baphomet! Curse that devious wretch!"
a2290df7-23f0-4f11-9988-cab9511e7f0e: "That power would have destroyed you. Or is that what you want — self-destruction?"
459e1b8f-2676-48d8-8eca-e02978bb87bd: "That rule was invented for you — hic! — underlings. It doesn't apply to me. I mean more to the Commander than all of you put together, got it? 4631b46b-c8ee-4d76-b2ea-c0a03509cda1: "That's better... You will remember who your queen is. You will only listen to me and obey without thinking. And to anyone who stands in our way — death and blood!"
02ecc425-df76-4a5d-b0b4-985016a77104: "That's nothing more than a fantasy! How are we going to do it? Don't know? Then why are you feeding me pretty lies? A chief's judgment cannot be based on dreams." {n}She shoots you a resentful glare.{/n}
5734f84c-e400-4705-8058-67c4b5483a53: "That's ridiculous. I still trust you to have my back — what more proof do you need?"
61801c0d-b588-461f-a72c-eb6fe33538e6: "That's true. And I'm proud of the fact."
e3d49918-d8e5-43be-b705-86a047aa9909: "That'sh the Wenduag you know, and I know a different one. She losht her mother as a child, and shoon after — her father as well, our chief. It made her calloush, pushed her away from everyone, filled her with shuspicion and dishtrust. And from all that pain, her famed shtrength was born. She tormented hershelf on purposh, to cultivate that shtrength and enduransh. She never took a liking to anyone, never let anyone closhe to her heart. She was preparing hershelf for the day when everyone would leave her, like her father did. She wash preparing to be alone."
f534c207-29f9-4e39-b81e-f56f40b06626: "The chief's hand must be firm. I need to remind my warriors why I have the power of life and death over them. If they doubt my right to lead them, even for a moment, the tribe will fall."
a564d26b-0e71-47ef-87ca-39a53d08dcee: "The laboratory appears to be abandoned. But is it truly? I doubt it."
0a3715cd-df3b-405e-abf6-6e4e7321590f: "The law? Aren't you the ultimate law here? You're in charge and no one dares to disobey you or argue with you. And if someone did dare, after all — you just point your finger at them and I'll rip their brazen tongues out."
3a7e2d1f-e6da-4fbb-993b-ac294dd4e01c: "The mongrels must come with me and join the war."
4b55d88f-b7b9-4394-b726-34829738ee77: "The neather tribes are scattered throughout the caves, and their chiefs... I'll tell you this, Sull is decisive — impetuous, even — compared to many of the other chiefs. To gather them, we needed time, and that's exactly what we didn't have when Kenabres was burning, and demons were laying waste to the streets. And then there was the march on Drezen. There's no chance that terrified neathers, glimpsing the surface for the first time, would have able to keep pace with us on that march."
04a65fe9-52f9-4c5d-9cf8-a8bdc0cd0c59: "The only reason we didn't arrest her on the spot is because she's a member of your party. But if you authorize it..."
d19719db-03e9-4df3-883c-55feb68a1881: "The pain is horrendous... in case you were wondering."
7fef3ead-c75d-48de-9481-41b7d12162d4: "The poison contains Savamelekh's power. This is the poison our ancestors tasted, and they became the first of our kind. The demon gave his poison to everyone who swore to serve him. When you try it for the first time, it feels like two mad scorpions have clawed their way into your brain through your ears and have begun a fight to the death inside your head."
269085be-d122-4c9c-8cd9-6bc579ec98b1: "The right to give orders is taken, not given. Wenduag took it, and you lost it."
bea8e97d-4647-4eb7-9784-74c1937f8786: "The temptation is great, {mf|master|mistress}, very great... I'd be happy to gut someone, but I should save my strength until I meet Savamelekh."
f982b1c4-5c7e-4a82-a13c-a92a85960c84: "Their road will not be easy. If my tribe is lucky, they might be able to win a fight for some piece of desolate wasteland, and eke out an existence there, just as they did in the caves. And if not... I suppose they will die. But I won't live long enough to find out either way."
3bbb8057-1de4-430d-8ee6-68fea100575c: "Then why am I here and not in your bed already?" {n}Wenduag smirks and snaps her teeth playfully, showing off her sharp fangs.{/n} "If you want me, I'm not opposed to the idea. I've long been wondering if you are as good in bed as you are in battle."
33573b13-5768-44a7-a5f4-24aa8dc7ac52: "Then you have no reason to be afraid. You're a true {mf|son|daughter} of the Abyss. The poison of a demon won't kill you."
e4f8d087-8798-4d23-9f6c-7c036830e3bf: "Then, who are you? Just my pet. All of you are my little pets, my creatures, and I am your creator. Wasn't I the one who nurtured you, child? Would you like to have another taste of my poison, sinking your teeth into a helpless victim and feeling it wash over your tongue? Or are you strong enough to take it from my stinger? 5734fd72-4dac-48b6-8ffb-f760ac701d51: "There is no reason to be afraid. We'll survive the war together."
0af6d856-c8a8-4416-9f1c-e0d23943ec14: "There is nothing to argue about. I'm not going with you and none of those who believe me will.
